publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of God in Text I-1; name of St. Mary in Text I-4); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letters ይ, ር and ዎ of the word ይባርክዎ in Canticle 10 (fols. 118v-119v); initial word or an abbreviation of the refrain in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs and the text dividers.
A few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 to I-4. Two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of the daily readings in Text I-4.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 147.0 folios, of which blank 1r, 129r, 130v, 147v, in 20.0 quires (A+19).
27.5 19.0 7.5

collation.signatures: Decorated - Simply decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 13r, 21r, 29r, 37r, 45r, 53r, 61r, 69r, 77r, 85r, 93r, 95r, 103r, 111r, 119r, 139r.

list.item: 8 ፲፪XIII(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 8; 8, stub after 1/fols. 95r-102v)

9 ፲፮XIX(9; s.l. 8, stub after 1/fols. 139r-147v).
Quires XII and XVII were probably inserted at a later time.

supportDesc.condition: The overback is damaged. The front board attachement is damaged. The Ms. was resewn. Fols. 1-4 (quire A) are loose. A hole is burnt into fol. 8. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt. Additional fols. with illuminations have been inserted in a recent time: fols. 93, 94, 129, 130. A cut on fol. 60 has been carefully amended.

layout.note: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 9r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling

layout.note: Text I-4: all data for fol. 135r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote:
Fine, regular Black and red (vivid vermillion) Gäbrä ʾIyäsus (?)The name of the scribe has been erased from the supplication on fol. 144a, but one part, Gäbrä, can still be discerned. The full name was possibly Gäbrä ʾIyäsus.Mid-19th century
እ᎓/እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 102v-103r).
ስቡ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 118v-119v).
Text I-4
ሰ፡/ሰ፡ አ፡ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡
Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain.
ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 131r-v)
እ᎓/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነ (fols. 132r-133r)
ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 133v-134v).
ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 135v-136v)
ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 137ra-vb)
ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 138va-139ra)
ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 139va-140rb).

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 5r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces and floral motifs.
- Fol. 41v: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and floral motifs.
- Fol. 77r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces, and floral motifs.
- Fol. 111r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces, and floral motifs.
- Fol. 122v: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and geometric motifs.
- Fol. 131r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with three lateral pendants pointed down the entire text area; interlaces, and floral motifs.

list.item:
Fols. 1va-2rb: Unidentified text.
The note is damaged by water and partly abraded; it is for the most part illegible.

Fols. 2va-3vb: Mälkǝʿa ʾIyäsus “Image of Jesus” (ChRep 199, no. 122), continuation of Additio 7.Fol. 2va: ሰላም፡ ለሐቌከ፡ እንዘቦ፡ ልዕልና፡ ከመ፡ ገብር፡ ድኩም፡ ዘቀነተ፡ ሀብለ፡ ትሕትና፨ ...
The prayer is written in a fine hand, in red and black ink. A curious way of sloping the top part of the letters ረ and ፈ. The incipit of the text is on fol. 144vb (Additio 8).

Fol. 4ra: ʾArke-hymn to angels.
The note is carelessly written; it praises different angels for defence against evil demons, etc.

Fol. 110v: Ownership note.Fol. 110v: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፨
The note is written in the main hand, in red. It states that the book belongs to Zä-Wäldä Maryam.

Fol. 128v: Protective prayer.
The note is written in the lower part of the leaf, in a later hand, damaged by water. It invokes ʾasmat-names.

Fol. 129r: Ownership note. Fol. 129r: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ የሸም፡ ዓጋሜ፡ ገብረ፡ ተክሌ፡ ዝመጽሐፈ፡ ዘአጽሐፈ፡ ዘሰረቃ፡ ዘፈሐቃ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡
The note is written in a later, careless hand, probably as a writing exercise. It states that the Ms. belongs to šum ʿagame Gäbrä Täkle (Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot). The same hand wrote Additio 5.

Fols. 144vb-147rb: Mälkǝʿa ʾIyäsus “Image of Jesus” (ChRep 199, no. 122). Fol. 144vb: ሰላም፡ ለዝክረ፡ ስምከ፡ ሰመ፡ መሐላ፡ ዘኢይሄሱ፡ ዘአንበረ፡ ቅድመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በአትሮንሱ፨ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዳዊት፡ ...
Written by the same hand as Additio 1. It is the incipit for the text continuing in Additio 2. At the end (fol. 147vb) the words ተመለስ፡ ለሐቌከ፡ እ ("return to: ለሐቌከ፡ እ") indicate exactly where the text is to be resumed; ለሐቌከ፡ እ[ንዘቦ] are the beginning words of Additio 2 (on fol. 2va).

- The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating red and black dots. No separation between Pss. 10/11, 30/31, 150/151. - Numerous directives on use of the Pss. for protective and medical purposes are written in the upper margin or at the end of the lines, in a fine secondary hand: fols. 5r, 6r, 6v, 7v, 8r, 8v, 9r, 11r, 11v, 12r, 12v, 13r, etc. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 13v, 14r, 16r, 22v, 30r, 34r. - The line is taken up: e.g., fols. 11v, 20v, 29v, 48r, 66r, 84. - The line is taken down on fol. 20r. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong: fols. 143va l.11, 144ra l.2. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin lines above and below words or encircling the letters: e.g., fol. 5v. - Omitted lines are written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 57r, 84r, 88v, 106r, 142v. - Hardly readable note ደብረ፡ ብርሃን፡ ያስክሮች...(?): fol. 1r, below. - An erased donation or ownership note, in the main hand: fol. 76v. - Crude notes and scribbles, in recent hands: fols. 11v, 12r, 17v, 18r, 25v, 26r, 34v, 35r, 42v, 46v, 47r, 55r, 64v, 65r, 72, 86v, 87r, 94v, 110v, 129r, 130v, 147v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback made of reddish-brown untooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornaments on the leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, wave form, single line fillet, small x).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 4, the Ms. belongs to Zä-Wäldä Maryam. The name of Wälättä Ḥǝywät has been erased from the subscriptio (supplication) on fol. 144vb but can still be discerned.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
